meanings.definition: A person who insinuates or suggests something indirectly or subtly.
meanings.sent1: The insinuators at the party were always dropping hints about the surprise.
meanings.sent2: She was known as one of the insinuators in the office, always implying things without saying them outright.
meanings.sent3: The insinuators in the mystery novel turned out to be the least expected characters.
meanings.sent4: Their words were like insinuators, weaving through the conversation with hidden meanings.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the insinuators, for their intentions may not always be clear.

meanings.definition: The act of insinuating or suggesting something indirectly or subtly.
meanings.sent1: Her insinuators were so subtle that many missed the underlying message.
meanings.sent2: The insinuators in her speech left room for interpretation and speculation.
meanings.sent3: The insinuators of the play added an element of mystery to the storyline.
meanings.sent4: The insinuators of the wind whispered secrets through the trees.
meanings.sent5: The insinuators of the painting drew the viewer's attention to the hidden details.
